title.narrative: GH Second Urban Environmental Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve urban living conditions in regard to environmental health, sanitation, drainage, vehicular access, and solid waste management in a sustainable fashion, with special emphasis on the poor.

condition.narrative: Deposit into this account an initial amount of $25,000 equivalent and the remaining part of its contributions, quarterly inadvancein amounts determined by the Borrower and the Association.
Open and maintain in cedis in a commercial bank, a MLGRD matching fund account on terms and conditions satisfactory to theAssociation.
The Borrower shall provide in its annual budget during implementation sufficient amounts to cover its counterpart contributions.

title.narrative: Percent of people living or working near the newly lined drains who report reduced flooding.

comment.narrative: No baseline since the measurement is based on the benefit after the works are completed and heavy rain events take place
A thorough beneficiary assessment was launched to evaluate the impact of drainage activities in urban flood prevention.

title.narrative: Additional number of school children gaining access to satisfactory latrines.

comment.narrative: Number of school children gaining access to satisfactory latrines.
1,412 seats completed out of 1,670 target (85% completed)

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Sanitation under the project

comment.narrative: Target for household toilets has been exceeded by 34%.

title.narrative: Reduction in number of residents of the communities in the project complaining about refuse accumulations and flooding.

comment.narrative: A thorough beneficiary assessment was launched to evaluate the impact of drainage and solid waste activities. The results will beincluded in the ICR

title.narrative: Length of access roads to communities surfaced, with roadside drains.

comment.narrative: All works have been completed in Tamale, Sekondi-Takoradi, Accra, Tema And Kumasi, including the additional works.

title.narrative: No. of WMDs in which at least 60% of the serviceable waste management equipment is in operating condition.
